citation.article-title: Sunxiuqinia elliptica gen. nov., sp. nov., a member of the phylum Bacteroidetes isolated from sediment in a sea cucumber farm
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sunxiuqinia elliptica sp. nov.
Sunxiuqinia elliptica [el.lip′ti.ca. N.L. fem. adj. elliptica elliptic (from Gr. n. elleipsis ellipse), referring to the cell shape].
Main characteristics are as given for the genus.
Colonies are circular, 1–3 mm in diameter, convex and smooth.
At early stages of growth, colonies seldom show distinct pigmentation; the colour ranges from whitish to slightly pink.
After more prolonged incubation (>5 days), an orange–red colour is apparent on MA.
Grows at 15–42 °C (optimum 30 °C), pH 5–9 (optimum pH 7–8) and 0.5–10 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum 3 %).
Negative for hydrolysis of starch, gelatin, Tweens 20 and 80, urea and DNA.

In API 20NE tests, the type strain is positive for indole production, aesculin hydrolysis and β-galactosidase but negative for nitrate reduction, gelatin hydrolysis, arginine dihydrolase and urease activity and utilization of d-glucose, d-mannose, l-arabinose, malic acid, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, potassium gluconate, capric acid, adipic acid, trisodium citrate and phenylacetic acid.
The following carbohydrates can be used as sole carbon sources: d-fructose, l-rhamnose, d-xylose, myo-inositol, sorbitol, trehalose, d-mannitol, ribose, raffinose, gluconate, malonate and propionate.

The following compounds are not used as sole carbon and energy sources: lactose, d-galactose, d-glucose, maltose, l-arabinose, citrate, fumarate, glycerol, d-mannose, cellobiose, adonitol, starch, aesculin, ethanol, formate and d-salicin.

In API ZYM tests, negative for cystine aminopeptidase, trypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase and α-mannosidase but positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), lipase (C14), esterase lipase (C8), valine aminopeptidase, leucine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, acid phosphatase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, β-glucosidase, α-glucosidase and α-fucosidase.

In API 50CH tests, acid is produced from l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, adonitol, methyl β-xyloside, l-rhamnose, d-mannitol, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin, d-salicin, cellobiose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, melezitose, raffinose, starch, glycogen, gentiobiose, turanose, l-fucose and 5-ketogluconate.

Sensitive to (µg per disc, unless otherwise indicated) doxycycline (30), erythromycin (15), novobiocin (30), rifampicin (5), lincomycin (2), clindamycin (2) and chloramphenicol (30) and resistant to ampicillin (10), carbenicillin (100), cefalexin (30), ciprofloxacin (5), kanamycin (30), nalidixic acid (30), neomycin (30), penicillin G (10 IU), streptomycin (10), tetracycline (30), oxacillin (1), polymyxin B (300 IU) and vancomycin (30).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 43.5 mol%.
The type strain, DQHS4T ( = CGMCC 1.9156T = NCCB 100301T = LMG 25367T), was isolated from sediment of a seashore pond for sea cucumber culture at Jimo, Qingdao, on the east coast of China.
